Our first big placement ever was Where Does The Good Go in the first season of Grey's Anatomy back in 2005.  It's still one of our biggest songs 17 years later for that reason.  A great placement can bring a new audience to a band whether they are brand new, or established!

Thank you @amazonmusic for making us Artist of the Month!!Â  We cannot WAIT to drop another new song soon. We are so grateful for all the early support of our new music.Â  Donâ€™t forget to go listen to our song Fucking Up What Matters. Link in bio! https://t.co/cGs78PnbSG

The wonderful @Vans also funded our #LGBTQ Summer Camperships program! This is @teganandsarafdn  longest-running program, it supports LGBTQ+ summer camps in the U.S. and Canada.  Thank you to Vans for making so many young LGTBQ+ people's dream of attending camp happen this year!

Couldn't be more proud or thrilled to be partnered with @Vans this year at @teganandsarafdn !!! With their help, we did a round of funding for our Trans Youth Community Grants program, which supports amazing organizations uplifting Trans youth.  Thanks, @Vans â¤ï¸

My favorite part of our substack is reading comments on our posts, but also posting Sara and I's text conversations.  These ones are from our latest post about when I got Covid. I told Sara I had taken one advil and one tylenol. Her response, I take three advil for a hangover. ğŸ˜‚ https://t.co/8o6IEBSuzw

Remember when we used to hang out socially distanced? And the chronic hives I got in early Feb 2020 that I swear were a weird COVID symptom?? All those memories came flooding back when I got COVID (officially) for the first time a few weeks ago. Read more: https://t.co/sYmzKSMDQj
for the record, she's never pooped in the house. which is what makes it so funny. https://t.co/ZTipxmq5tL

i never wanted a dog, but my gf was desperate for one.  the dog ruined our lives (in the best way).  she just turned two and i love her. but to get back at my gf from time to time i yell "oh no she pooped" when i go upstairs and wait for my gf to come running. and it feels great.

Sara is always calling us old. I've started to do it too.   I know we are getting older, but inside I still feel  19 (call me). Having an identical twin is like having a mirror with you all the time.  I chart the changes in my face, on hers. Read about it: https://t.co/G5RJCSf8ls
